channel.title: Journal on indi.bio
channel.description: Recent content in Journal on indi.bio

item.description: I want to write about my code projects. Where can I do that? Code Projects #Diaries 2024-01-21 20:55: The internet is such a cool thing. I spent today working on my website and home automation stuff, and now I’m hanging out with my best friends on Discord. We live thousands of miles away, yet we can chat as if we were sitting next to each other. Each day I wake up grateful that I was born in the 21st century.

09:12 I need to refactor the code for this website and improve the content. Thereâ€™s not really anything worth reading on it at the moment and I want to change that. I have lots of ideas, but every time I sit down to write at my computer I donâ€™t feel motivated to make content. How can I fix that? DONE FixÂ Templates DONE Check ifÂ <% today %>Â macro works for hugo ssg DONE RedoÂ ðŸ“„ README.

I’ve done a few projects recently, and I want to add them to the site TODO Write about image recognition project TODO Write about inspection modularization Let’s pause and zoom out for a sec - I don’t like the structure of this graph. It doesn’t work well with the way I’ve structured my Hugo templates. Move to Graph Structure TODO Write script to convert Logseq frontmatter to YAML for Cosma parsing

This is my first page! I intend to use journals (pages titled with a date) as working spaces. All actual content should be on its own page. Things to note when working on this site: Logseq-schrodinger uses YAML for the HugoÂ front-matter. It will convert Logseq page-properties to Hugo front matter. LogseqÂ keywordsÂ are lowercase converted to Hugo keywords, andÂ categoryÂ in Logseq is translated toÂ categoriesÂ for use with Hugo.
